Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Training to Improve Diagnosis of Scaphoid Fracture Displacement

Participants.evidence: 64 orthopaedic surgeons were randomised into a training group (34) and a nontraining group (30)

Intervention.evidence: training group received an online module before assessment

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates whether training can enhance interobserver reliability and diagnostic accuracy for scaphoid fracture displacement

Method_Outcome.evidence: Interobserver reliability was measured using Siegel’s multirater kappa

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomisation was computer-generated with allocation concealment

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not applicable as the intervention was educational

Number_Randomised.evidence: 64 orthopaedic surgeons were randomised into a training group (34) and a nontraining group (30)

Result_Outcome.evidence: Sensitivity, specificity, and accuracy were 87%, 86%, and 87% for the training group, and 83%, 85%, and 84% for the nontraining group

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided in the manuscript

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided in the manuscript
